as well it looks like where you are you pay much higher mortgage and utilities and have student loans in addition to that so can sort of see how you re using up all your money even though to me 150k salary would make us feel like millionaires see if you can get some budgeting help try to cook meals at home with as few groceries as possible cut out all unnecessary expenses memberships games etc do your best to save on electricity and water by turning off the lights when you re not using them and not running the water for too long beyond that ca offer much help good luck deleted we got rid of cable tv just kept internet and netflix consolidated credit card debt by rolling it into single low interest personal loan and reduced our cell phone plan when my husband lot his job few years back we managed to live off of my income alone for ~5 mos did wind up taking out small loan against my retirement to make it through that last month though is it possible to move someplace outside the city and commute do know what your situation is but it might be worth looking into that along with some debt consolidation and strict budgeting might get you where you want to be ps wish my hubby made 150k become sahm in heartbeat or at least cut back to pt it difficult to not be judgemental of someone who brings home figures but ca manage that kind of money it quite conundrum sure thank you you re blessed to have family we have none both only children and deceased parents makes things tad more difficult by always having to rely and pay babysitters honestly it is either you are relaly in *that* big of debt and need to restack how you are paying credit cards and school or you are leaking money have you created budget can you tell me right now how much money every month you spend on dining out on the coffee you get in the morning on the trips to the mall lot of people do realize that their little and 10 purchases add up *quickly* not accusing you of being some kind of mindless consumer but do you give yourself monthly allowance and stick to it ve used both mint and ynab and find the latter to be better would suggest visiting personalfinance as well as frugal and try to get more advice families operate on 30k year and *less* and manage to not drown in debt you really should take eve advice and look over your expenses there is serious issue here if you are bringing home one hundred fifty thousand dollars and are struggling need to not for college certainly if your priorities are such that you place higher value on your current standard of living than being sahm that up to you but that what they are priorities and not needs if you re spending more than 50 per person per week on food you could cut back you could cut back even farther than that honestly if you have cable tv you could drop it same with landline phone in most cases if you go on vacations or cross country visits to family friends you can cut down and skype instead if you go out to the movies and have date nights you can limit them if you buy coffee in the morning you could make your own if you have high car payments you could sell and buy cheaper older reliable used care for about 10k you could sell your house and move to smaller one if you dropped your husband income you could potentially move to an income based repayment plan on your student loans they wo take more than 10 you may not see these things as extravagances maybe you grew up in wealthy families or maybe you ve just had this standard of living for while but they are you can cut them out just seeing your other post where you mention 1000 for food each month that very high unless you have several kids my husband makes around 60 000 and am sahm to 2yo with one on the way we live in the twin cities so urban metro area and own home two cars and have what we consider nice standard of living we save for retirement and college not as much as like but we do manage to max out roths for each of us and put bit away for kids college part of the time and use store brand disposables we do go out on the town lot vacations are generally going to see family with big thing like international travel or disney only every five years or so shop at thrift stores especially for kids clothing and toys and we ve tried our hand at thrifty hobbies like woodworking and gardening great blog for learning how to budget and get out of debt is the where near in the kind of trouble you are in as someone whose family also brings home figures can tell you that there is lot of work you need to do to figure out where the leaks are your budget is absolutely the first thing you need to take care of you need to look at every single penny that goes into your bank account and then be watching where it goes when it leaves so before anything make budget even if it is just in excel or google doc it can take time to figure out put aside weekend to go through your bank statements or online account for say august plug every single expense in and see what you re looking at really ca stress doing this on paper enough just thinking in your head well we make every month and goes to this and goes to that we should have plenty left over is not going to cut it once you know *where* money is going you can start to control it if you see that you are spending 300 month on coffee you can swap that out for 10 canister of folger instead if you already live what you consider comfortable lifestyle eating out lots of alcohol in the house new clothes and home goods every few months it might be time to step back and lower expectations until you can get full handle on this the fact that you are willing to get rid of cable suggests to me that you may be living at comfortable and not willing to change living below your means is key even if you make millions of dollars maybe no one is answering questions about saving for their kids future because they do have the extra funds saving is not often part of the equation when you are living
